image.altText: Canberra's coat of arms

props.synopsis: The trial of a teenage girl accused of sexually assaulting and stalking her former boyfriend ends with no result, after an ACT Supreme Court jury is unable to reach a verdict.

title.children: Jury unable to reach verdict in trial of a teen girl accused of assaulting, stalking ex

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios stands in front of a microphone, flanked by two ACT politicians.

props.synopsis: Construction on a new $9.9 million tennis facility in the Gungahlin has begun five years after the ACT government pledged funding for it ahead of the 2020 territory election.

title.children: Nick Kyrgios spruiks construction of $9.9m tennis facility in Canberra's north

image.altText: Josh Papalii pictured in action for the Raiders

props.synopsis: The Raiders star's lawyers are asking the ACT Magistrates Court to permanently stay charges against him over a 2024 incident.

title.children: Papalii's lawyers say 'wicked' deleted police chat should halt charges

image.altText: A display for a soldier in a war memorial.

props.synopsis: The war memorial's revised display now mentions Ben Roberts-Smith's failed bid to the High Court.

title.children: Australian War Memorial updates Ben Roberts-Smith display a third time

image.altText: Close up shot of a woman's hands clasped on a lap

props.synopsis: The ACT government says coercive control will become a standalone offence by mid-2026, but opposition leader Leanne Castley says that's not soon enough.

title.children: 'Hidden' form of abuse set to become a crime in the ACT

image.altText: An aerial view of a golf course with suburban houses around its edge.

props.synopsis: With the ACT government pushing for greater urban density, golf courses in inner Canberra suburbs are becoming attractive sites for redevelopment to provide much-needed housing and a way for struggling clubs to bolster their budgets.

title.children: 'Sustainable development': Golf course reimagined for club and housing

image.altText: The ball is bounced in the middle of an Aussie Rules oval, with the ocean in the background.

props.synopsis: Initially laughed off, these pioneers from Victoria were determined to challenge Australia's sporting status quo, and their legacy continues today.

title.children: Barassi line 'has to be moved' as AFL popularity grows in league country

image.altText: Michelle Heyman smiles

props.synopsis: A fit-again Sam Kerr doesn't necessarily spell the end for Michelle Heyman's time in the Matildas, if anything the A-League star can't wait for her return.

title.children: 'Imagine both of us': Heyman ready for Kerr return

image.altText: A six-lane road bridge across a lake with a strip in the middle.

props.synopsis: Many Canberrans travel across it every day, but major upgrades addressing the structural safety of the Commonwealth Avenue Bridge are set to create two years of significant traffic disruption.

title.children: Commonwealth Avenue Bridge upgrade likely to cause commuter chaos

image.altText: A doctor wearing scrubs standing in an operating theatre holding medical plastic tubes

props.synopsis: In a ruined hospital and with little medication, these two Australian doctors are desperately trying to save Gazans maimed by Israel's attacks.

title.children: 'Unhuman and horrific': Australian doctors in Gaza decry Israel's destructive attacks

image.altText: Jahrome Hughes breaks through a Will Kennedy tackle.

props.synopsis: Jahrome Hughes leads Melbourne back into the NRL grand final, scoring a try in a 22-14 win over the Cronulla Sharks just 22 days after breaking his arm.

title.children: Hughes defies broken arm to spark Storm into another grand final

image.altText: A man in a dark shirt is escorted towards the open door offf a police truck by a uniformed officer.

props.synopsis: The man has been sentenced over 18 child sex offences against 10 victims from Australia, the US and the UK.

title.children: RAAF serviceman sentenced for international child abuse offences

image.altText: A man looks at the TikTok app on an iPad.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has signed an executive order that he says will allay security concerns regarding Chinese influence on social media platform TikTok.

title.children: Trump signs TikTok executive order but who's in charge of the platform now?

image.altText: A view from underwater, looking up at a group of people snorkeling, wearing wetsuits.

props.synopsis: A magistrate has sentenced a Great Barrier Reef tourism operator that pleaded guilty to a workplace health and safety breach following the death of a passenger in 2022.

title.children: Tourism operator fined $60k for safety breach after snorkeller's death

image.altText: Two men, one in a blue polo shirt and cap and the other in a maroon top, hold up a silver trophy cup on a stage.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Brisbane and Geelong fans have lined the streets around the MCG ahead of the 2025 AFL Grand Final.

title.children: Passion and nerves hit fever pitch at AFL Grand Final parade

image.altText: Young athlete Codie Davidson holds a paddle and smiles as she stands next to fellow canoe slalom athlete Jess Fox

props.synopsis: Jess Fox says she's recovering well from her recent surgery, and while she's disappointed to miss her home world championships, she's willing to play the role of 'cheerleader'.

title.children: Jess Fox puts aside surgery shock to support teammates at home world champs

image.altText: Ron Brierley walks with a cane down the road in a grey jumper.

props.synopsis: Ron Brierley, 88, was charged in March with three counts of the offence, about three years after an appeals court overturned a previous jail term for similar offending because of his ill-health and conditions in custody.

title.children: Disgraced tycoon 'unfit for trial' on child abuse material charges

image.altText: A woman wearing a navy jacket stands in front of a crop.

props.synopsis: Even without Trump's tariffs, Australian farmers and exporters of agricultural produce are already losing out on an estimated $4 billion of annual export trade each year.

title.children: Even without Trump's tariffs, Australian farmers are losing out on billions

image.altText: A photo of Tammy Shipley smiling

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest into the death of an Aboriginal woman in custody will be free to assess police actions, after a legal challenge by police was dismissed.

title.children: Aboriginal death in custody inquest to resume after police legal challenge dismissed

image.altText: Artist's impression of a prehistoric species of human.

props.synopsis: A crushed million-year-old skull found in China that has been digitally reconstructed reopens a debate in human evolution.

title.children: Million-year-old skull shakes up the human family tree, scientists say

image.altText: Alex de Minaur holds up his racquet

props.synopsis: Aussie Alex de Minaur is through to the China Open round of 16 thanks to a crushing straight-sets win over a local wildcard, while in Japan Aleksandar Vukic has recorded a second win to set up a tasty quarterfinal clash.

title.children: De Minaur, Vukic power through in ATP Tour's Asia swing

image.altText: Police officers in the street usher crowds.

props.synopsis: Timor-Leste votes to cancel the lifetime pension law for MPs and public officials, following student-led demonstrations against lavish perks in one of South-East Asia's poorest countries.

title.children: Timor-Leste scraps lifetime pensions after student-led protests

image.altText: FMNR Africa

props.synopsis: A Victorian scientist whose farming technique has revolutionised agriculture in Niger is awarded an international peace prize.

title.children: Australian wins peace prize for farming idea feeding millions in Africa

image.altText: A man in navy uniform and emblem of a red flag demonstrates a martial arts move to two other men in lighter blue uniform

props.synopsis: Vanuatu's internal affairs minister says Australia needs to respect his country's plan to sign a new policing agreement with China, and has taken a swipe at Pacific Minister Pat Conroy as controversy over the proposal rumbles along.

title.children: Vanuatu minister tells Australia to respect China policing deal

image.altText: Brown paper bags filled with drugs pictured next to bullet proof police vests

props.synopsis: Six men involved in a drug importation operation described by the prosecutor as a "comedy of errors" are jailed in Perth.

title.children: 'In over your heads': Judge blasts 'fools' for shambolic drug smuggling plot

image.altText: The silhouette of a woman, indoors.

props.synopsis: Years of fighting have created a crisis among Ukrainian children, with thousands estimated to have been transferred to Russia, where some are placed in so-called "re-education camps".

title.children: Tania's parents took her to Russia, where she says they were 'brainwashed'

image.altText: Kids toys on the floor.

props.synopsis: Non-profit childcare providers have pushed back against the NSW government's plan to triple maximum penalties for breaching regulations.

title.children: Child care 'risks losing more' staff in NSW under plan for bigger fines

image.altText: A man being led by multiple police officers into the back of a paddy wagon.

props.synopsis: One of the four co-accused teenagers in an alleged gang rape in Sydney's south-west in December has been granted bail in the NSW Supreme Court.

title.children: 19yo man allegedly involved in six-hour gang rape of girl granted bail

image.altText: Nick Dametto speaks into a microphone.

props.synopsis: State MP Nick Dametto resigns his seat to run in Townsville's local government by-election, following the resignation of the city's suspended mayor.

title.children: Katter MP stepping down to run in Townsville election after mayor resigns

image.altText: Josh Dunkley of the Lions attempting to catch a ball from a Cats player.

props.synopsis: Wondering what time the AFL grand final starts and how you can watch it live? We've got you covered.

title.children: Ultimate guide to the 2025 AFL grand final decider between Geelong and Brisbane

image.altText: Four people sitting on bleachers by an ocean pool; a woman in swimmers and a pink cap has her arms raised, pulling a funny face

props.synopsis: A new headphone theatre production is set among the swimmers and sunbakers at a NSW city's much-loved ocean pool.

title.children: 'Like a magic pair of goggles': Theatre show set at 100-year-old ocean baths

image.altText: An older man and woman looking at the camera with houses and boats in the bacground.

props.synopsis: GIM Trading has been accused of defrauding Aussie investors out of millions of dollars. Financial investigators say the company created a veneer of legitimacy and evidence suggested overseas criminals could be involved.

title.children: Investors 'misled' by flashy marketing as Aussies lose millions

image.altText: A dark-haired woman and a fair-haired man, both formally dressed, standing outside a court complex.

props.synopsis: Jenna McGregor says she will forever treasure the moments she had with baby Hugo, who died in a Queensland hospital five days after his birth in 2023.

title.children: Inquest hears heart-wrenching testimony from newborn boy's mother

image.altText: Mr Squiggle

props.synopsis: The man who wrote the music for many well-known advertising jingles, including Good on You Mum, Tip Top bread and Take Me Away, P&O, is being remembered for his musical skill.

title.children: Mr Squiggle theme songwriter and composer of thousands of jingles dies

image.altText: A dead shark lies on the sand of a beach

props.synopsis: Investigations into nine great white shark deaths this year have revealed at least three are likely to have been killed by the toxic algal bloom. Warning: This story contains images that some readers may find distressing.

title.children: At least three shark deaths linked to algal bloom, report shows
